data.title: Never stop on breakpoints when debug react-native app (android)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 x 64, home

Steps to Reproduce:
1. setup breakpoints in react-native app (android) js code

Previous VSCode version (1.5.3) working as expected.

data.title: Stop sending output contents to the extension host
[completion] CompletionList#isIncomplete ignored on empty or fully filtered items
Revisit extension disablement implementation
data.body:
Although it supports all use cases, the current solution seems far from optimal, especially considering the architecture changes it creates and its implementation.

We started off the story by saying _we want to support disabling extensions globally and per workspace_. We figured out user settings were not the best place for that since workspace settings are usually checked into SCM. At the same time we decided that we want the files to be manually edited by the user. That excluded the storage service. A new concept was needed of global storage (`extensions.json`) that the user could edit by hand.

This introduced a [new method](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/node/storage.ts#L199) in the storage service which creates a bit of debt. Its implementation is also _way_ far from optimal: it's filled with synchronous IO calls. We definitely don't want to do that.

Later this week we decided to do UI for disablement. This drops the requirement for having the files be user-editable. We don't need this new storage concept anymore.

I suggest to take a step back and simply store the disablement state in the `IStorageService` available to the renderer, removing the newly introduced storage concept.

data.title: Hot Exit: Support hot exit on empty workspaces

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.title: There is no key binding for show next global find mach.
data.body: Please add show next find match when global search is used. It is not fast to select find result with mouse.

data.title: Support file with subitems
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Windows 10.0.14393

For webapp framework like angular2, a web component is designed to contains multiple files. For example:

mycomponent.ts
mycomponent-template.html
mycomponent-style.css

I hope there is a way to collapse these items together:
mycomponent.ts
   \_mycomponent-template.html
   \_mycomponent-style.css

Just like *.xaml, *.xaml.cs for WPF in Visual Studio

data.body:

1. Debugging Nodejs
2. Hit a break point
3. Continue

The word should be "respond" instead of "repond".

data.title: Support xml namespaces in JSX
data.body:
Visual Studio Code reports syntax errors if namespaces are used inside JSX.

Namespaces are not supported by React (babel-plugin-transform-react-jsx), 
but Babel correctly parses them (babel-plugin-syntax-jsx).

Is this something that should be added directly to VSCode or an extension would be a better choice?

WebStorm and Sublime Text do not have this problem.

data.title: The workspace is frozen after opening any project
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  ![2016-10-14_09h20_33](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/19377506/7939712c-91ef-11e6-86c3-e4fd6721f12b.png)
- OS Version: win7 pro

The workspace is frozen after opening any project. And the console displays the error:
_Failed to clear temp storage: It was determined that certain files are unsafe for access within a Web application, or that too many calls are being made on file resources. SecurityError_

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VSCode
2. Open any project
3. In the developer console diplays an error
   
   > _Failed to clear temp storage: It was determined that certain files are unsafe for access within a Web application, or that too many calls are being made on file resources. SecurityError_
4. All workspace element does not respond to any user action

data.title: Always indents HTMLs with tabs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Win 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. add workspace settings.json 
   "editor.detectIndentation": false,
   "editor.insertSpaces": true,
2. open *.html file formatted with spaces
3. press alt+shift+f to format document -> spaces are converted to tabs which is wrong

data.title: Unable to collapse sidebar by default
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
Before VSCode 1.6, the sidebar is collapsed by default. It works fine for smaller display, as well as non-project files. Since 1.6, the sidebar is expanded when VSCode launches. I'm yet to find any mention of this change in the release note, nor find way to set a preference to reverse this. I'm not sure if this change is intentional or a regression.
1. Launch VSCode.
2. Examine the sidebar.

Go to Definition does not work for PHP
data.body:
When clicking on the class name and hit F12 (Go to Definition), nothing happens.
Ex: $acc = new Account();
Is it a bug or anything else should be installed or configured?

Thanks.

data.title: VSCode 1.6.1 x64 rpm require some i686 rpm
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: CentOS 7.2.1511

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run "yum install code-1.6.1-1476373175.el7.x86_64.rpm"
Some output are
Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile
--> Running transaction check
---> Package libXScrnSaver.i686 0:1.2.2-6.1.el7 will be installed
--> Processing Dependency: libc.so.6(GLIBC_2.4) for package: libXScrnSaver-1.2.2-6.1.el7.i686
--> Processing Dependency: libXext.so.6 for package: libXScrnSaver-1.2.2-6.1.el7.i686
--> Processing Dependency: libX11.so.6 for package: libXScrnSaver-1.2.2-6.1.el7.i686
--> Running transaction check
---> Package glibc.i686 0:2.17-106.el7_2.8 will be installed
--> Processing Dependency: libfreebl3.so(NSSRAWHASH_3.12.3) for package: glibc-2.17-106.el7_2.8.i686
--> Processing Dependency: libfreebl3.so for package: glibc-2.17-106.el7_2.8.i686
---> Package libX11.i686 0:1.6.3-2.el7 will be installed
--> Processing Dependency: libxcb.so.1 for package: libX11-1.6.3-2.el7.i686
---> Package libXext.i686 0:1.3.3-3.el7 will be installed
--> Running transaction check
---> Package libxcb.i686 0:1.11-4.el7 will be installed
--> Processing Dependency: libXau.so.6 for package: libxcb-1.11-4.el7.i686
---> Package nss-softokn-freebl.i686 0:3.16.2.3-14.2.el7_2 will be installed
--> Running transaction check
---> Package libXau.i686 0:1.0.8-2.1.el7 will be installed
--> Finished Dependency Resolution

Then I run "rpm -qpR code-1.6.1-1476373175.el7.x86_64.rpm", the output are
glibc >= 2.15
libXss.so.1
/bin/sh
/bin/sh
rpmlib(PayloadFilesHavePrefix) <= 4.0-1
rpmlib(CompressedFileNames) <= 3.0.4-1

I find libXScrnSaver rpm contains libXss.so.1. I remember 1.6.0 has not such problem, so I run "rpm -qpR code-1.6.0-1476123947.el7.x86_64.rpm", the output are.
glibc >= 2.15
libXScrnSaver
/bin/sh
/bin/sh
rpmlib(PayloadFilesHavePrefix) <= 4.0-1
rpmlib(CompressedFileNames) <= 3.0.4-1

I want to keep my pure 64 bits system and don't install any unncessary i686 rpm.

data.title: [Feature Request] Enable to open a file in string path
data.body:
It's better if we can open a file by right-clicking in a string path in code.
Ex: include('path/path/file.php');
Just right click in the string 'path/path/file.php' and select Open File command.

This feature is supported in Nusphere PHP ED.
Thanks.

data.title: Use default cursor in feedback menu text. #12926
When VSC has no open folder, please have "Integrated Terminal" open in same default folder
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T16:21:53.542Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: abusaidm.html-snippets-0.0.17, donjayamanne.python-0.4.2

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  File --> "Close Folder"
2. Push "Open Folder" & notice that VSC opens in a "default" folder [Now push CANCEL]
3.  View --> "Integrated Terminal" & notice that VSC opens "way up" in the user's home folder.

Please update VSC so that #3 opens into the same folder as #2 WHEN THERE IS NO OPEN FOLDER!

NOTE:  If you have specified "Open Folder," then View --> "Integrated Terminal" opens in the folder that you "Opened."  My request is for the case when there is NO OPEN FOLDER.

data.title: [Feature Request] Folder explorer and the opened files should be separated.
data.body:
The folder explorer is always focusing to the opened files. Which is not good and sometimes inconvenient .

**For example:**
- I purposely opened a file at root to edit
- After that, I tried to open another file at /path/path/file1.php. The folder explorer is focus to this file in /path/path/. It seems goods, but
- The file1.php have no information I needed then I close this file and intended to open file2.php in the folder /path/path. But after closing file1.php, the folder explorer automatically focus back to the opened file at root.
- To open /path/path/file2.php, I have to relocate the folder /path/path again, which take time in inconvenience for me.

**Suggested feature:**
- There should be a configuration to set auto-focus on opened file or not. User can select which option is best suite.
- In case the auto-focus is off. User can right click at the opened file name in editor to select 'Locate in Folder Explorer' option.

This feature is what Nusphere PHP ED supported and I think it is really smart.
Thanks.

data.title: Launch.json prop default value as URL?
data.body: vscode-chrome-debug sets the default value of 'url' as "http://mysite.com/index.html", but when I use autocomplete in the launch.json to get the default value, it shows up as `"url": "//mysite.com/index.html"`. Tried debugging a little but all I see is that it's loaded properly into the JSON schema. Don't know where it goes from there. Any ideas @weinand or @isidorn?

data.title: Why is solution loading project rather than Nuget Package? - help
data.body:
Hi, I'm running VS 2015 Update 3 and am seeing something quite strange.

I created a .xproj project (lets call it "ProjectA") which I deployed as a Nuget package to the Nuget store.

I then created a new solution and a new .xproj project (lets call it "ProjectB") from which I referenced the Nuget package for ProjectA.

There seemed to be an issue so I removed the package reference from my project.json file, added the ProjectA .xproj to my solution and debugged the issue successfully. I then removed ProjectA from my solution, re-deployed  ProjectA to the Nuget store and referenced the updated Nuget Package for ProjectA from ProjectB.

However, for some reason, whenever I open my solution or try and restore my packages, it still tries to load the ProjectA .xproj into my solution... even though there is no reference to it in the Solution file.

This is extremely strange behaviour. Does anyone know why this is happening and how to stop the .xproj loading into the solution when it has been removed?

data.title: Uninstalling an extension without enabling it should not suggest restart of VSCode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Mac OS X El Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install an extension from Marketplace and don't enable the extension or restart VSCode
2. Uninstall the extension
3. Message shows 

> _{Extension}_ was successfully uninstalled. Restart to deactivate it

The issue is that no restart is necessary since the extension was never active. I thought I would edit the`run()` method of `UninstallAction` to check for extension's state before uninstalling and display a different message and submit a Pull Request, but it uses a localized string _postUninstallMessage_. I am not sure how to go about changing it, please advise.

data.title: Allow to Open multiple files in background tabs from quick open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: Windows 10x64

While developing components that span across multiple files (.ts, .html, .css), it is quite common to need to open all related files for a given component. In Sublime, this is achieved by pressing `ctrl+right-arrow` while highlighting a result in their "quick open" panel. This opens the highlighted file in a background tab while keeping the existing results set open.

In VSCode, you have to perform the same query multiple times, each time selecting the next file.

Demo Gif:
[Background Open](http://i.imgur.com/nJ4T0aB.gifv)

data.title: Be able to open multiple repos at a time.
data.body:
Hello,
- VSCode Version:1.6
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
Consider following scenario: multiple Git repos are clones under one base directory (not Git initialized). The user want to be able to open more than one repo at the same time.

```
Repositories (base folder, not Git initialized)
  |
  |-- Project 1
  |-- Project 2
  |-- Project 3
.....
  |-- Project N

```

At the moment, if opening the Repositories folder in VSCode workspace, everything below will be considered as non-Git initialized even though they are.

Thank you kindly.

Lawrence

data.title: Editor hangs and cannot save document when editing JavaScript ES6 React files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Edit large JavaScript React ES6 files with a lot of various constructs, including JSX tags, `${somethin}`, spread operators, etc.
2. Have some mismatched tags
3. At some point it still continues to work but you no longer able to save file
4. Later it would stop responding and offer to reopen the window.
